subject: Re: Making gravity form field width thinner
preview: Hi Chris,  Thanks for that.  Yes it would be good to know what happens because before adding the Custom CSS suggested I had no issues changing the font and background of the gravity form.  Thanks,  Th

full_threads.body:
Hi Chris,

Thanks for that.

Yes it would be good to know what happens because before adding the Custom CSS suggested I had no issues changing the font and background of the gravity form.

Thanks,

Theo

Hi Theo,

Confirming the requested updates have been completed.

1. Revert border thickness to standard
2. Button to have Black BG and white text on hover
3. Introduce gap between email field and button to match email subscription

Please let us know if you would like us to further diagnose the colour issues you experienced.

Can someone please help with with this? It's very urgent now.

Thanks

Theo

Thanks - is there someone I can call about this?

I'm very confused, I've added the code which has changed but it changed all the other ones too on all sections?



This one below has no code applied...but still shows the same.



Also, when I hover to click on it the text stays white. How do we make the text black when we hover over it?



Finally, I've made the changes but when I go to preview not changes appear...



Can someone please call me? We have a big article coming out on Sunday about the release of our new range and need this page ready.

Thanks!

Theo

Hi Theo,

Thank you for your message. I understand your request to change the color of either the background or the text of the form. I'd like to inform you that to execute this change, custom CSS will be required. Given this, we recommend letting us handle the changes on our end to ensure accuracy and compatibility.

However, if you are determined to proceed with this on your own, you'll need to identify the CSS selector for the specific elements you wish to modify. Presently, the Shop Coming Soon page displays a single Register form on the frontend. After inspecting each form element, I've compiled the custom CSS codes below for your reference:

/* To change the email address field's backgrond color*/
body #gform_wrapper_44.gform_wrapper form .gform_body input
{
background: white!important;
}

/* To change the email address field text color*/
.gform_wrapper input:not([type=radio]):not([type=checkbox]):not([type=submit]):not([type=button]):not([type=image]):not([type=file]) {
color: red!important;
}

/* To change the register button's backgrond color*/
body #gform_wrapper_44.gform_wrapper form .gform_footer input#gform_submit_button_44 {
background: white!important;
}

/* To change the register button's text color*/
body #gform_wrapper_44.gform_wrapper form .gform_footer input[type="submit"] {
color: red!important;
}

I hope you find these CSS codes helpful. Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions or need further assistance. We're here to support you.
@glen please provide the custom css to do this

Hello,

I don't know yet because I'd like to test different colours and backgrounds?

Could you show me how to change that so I can test on the different pictures?

Id just like to know how to check the colours of the text and background.

Thanks

Theo

Hello Theo,

I would appreciate it if you could provide more details regarding the specific color you're interested in changing. Kindly specify the element or area of the design where you'd like the color modification, along with the exact color you wish to implement.

Once we have this information, our team will be able to promptly make the necessary changes on our end.

Should you have any questions or require further assistance, please don't hesitate to reach out.
Thanks! Yes that works but how do we change the colour?

Hi Theo,

We checked the page https://belance.com.au/shop-coming-soon and it seems that the Subscribe form and the register form have the same heights now.

Here's what we can see on our end:

Please note that we did not make any changes yet and that's what we saw when we check the page. If the issue persist on your end, could you please clear your browser's cache to make sure that you will see the latest version of the page.

Hi guys, any luck with this?

Thanks

Theo

@ricaV2 Most of these are coded.
we can assist them if they need help.

I've put them together here with an explanation of what we're trying to
achieve.

Thanks!

Theo

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Glen Tenorio

full_threads.body:
Hi guys!

Having a little issue here. I'm trying to create a landing page for our new online store. It's very simple, a page with image in the background and some text in the front asking to register email to be kept informed.

I've added a form Gravity but noticing that the the width (or height) of the field and button is bigger than the "Subscribe form". See below:

VERSION 1





So what I did is copy the shortcode of the "Subscribe" in the sticky template and copied it in the version we want but it's like this:

VERSION 2



My questions are:

1. In VERSION 1, how do we edit the height of the fields to match the same as the "SUBSCRIBE".

2. In VERSION 1, how do we have it so the "Your email address" field and "REGISTER" are next to each other like in VERSION 2?

3. If we wanted to change the VERSION 2 "Subscribe" section, how do we change the colour to be white?

Thanks!

--
Theodore English

BELANCĒ

8 William Street
Paddington NSW 2021

Phone | 0433 426 417
Web | belance.com.au
Insta | @belanceworld
